intro: Erodium glaucophyllum var. cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray erodium, is a flowering plant native to parts of California. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are covered in a fine, grayish-white pubescence. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in coastal and inland regions with mild, Mediterranean climates.
